summary: I HAVE A 1996 FORD WINDSTAR (3.8-LITER ENGINE) WITH ALMOST 78,000 MILES.  I'VE OWNED IS SINCE IT WAS NEW.  IT EXPERIENCED A BLOWN HEAD GASKET 3 WEEKS AGO.  THE SERVICE MANAGER AT BERT WEINMAN FORD HERE IN CHICAGO RECOMMENDED THAT I REPLACE THE ENGINE.  I DID SO AT A PRICE OF ALMOST $4500.  FROM WHAT I KNOW, FORD HAS A SERIOUS PROBLEM WITH HEAD GASKETS IN THIS ENGINE.  THEY HAVE OFFERED EXTENDED WARRANTY FOR SOME MODEL YEARS, BUT NONE WHICH COVERS MY VEHICLE.
